titleInfo.subTitle: STIPULATION and ORDER signed by Judge William B. Shubb on 11/12/09 ORDERING that 26 Default entered against Exxon Mobil Corporation is set aside. titleInfo.title: HSBC Bank, USA v. Dara Petroleum, Inc. et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Judge William B. Shubb on 4/13/2010 ORDERING 41 that pltf's motion for leave to amend the Complaint for the limited purpose of substituting HSBC as pltf and adding factual allegations addressing how HSBC became the holder of the Note be, and the same hereby is, GRANTED. Pltf shall file an amended complaint within 20 days of the date of this Order. The parties are ORDERED to produce expert witnesses; the hearing on pltf's 44 motion for judgment on the pleadings be, and the same hereby is, CONTINUED to 5/24/2010 at 02:00 PM in Courtroom 5 (WBS) before Judge William B. Shubb; and that all further discovery in this action is hereby STAYED pending the court's ruling on pltf's motion for judgment on the pleadings. (Reader, L)

titleInfo.title: HSBC Bank, USA v. Dara Petroleum, Inc. et al
titleInfo.subTitle: STIPULATION and ORDER signed by Judge William B. Shubb on 1/7/2011 79 Judgment is hereby ENTERED for cross-pltf USA and against cross-dfts Dara Petroleum, Inc., dba Watt Avenue Exxon, and Narges Eghtesadi, jointly and severally, for the balance owed on the Note (CDC/504 Loans), to wit, as of 9/15/2010, the principal sum of $492,766.71 and interest in the amount of $38,368.51, for a total of $531,135.22, plus a daily accrual of $68.34 in interest to the date of judgment, together with attorney's fees and costs in the amount of 10 percent, pursuant to 38:3011. Post-judgment interest shall accrue at the legal per annum percentage rate in effect at the time of its entry, computed daily and compounded annually until paid, pursuant to 28:1961, beginning on the date this judgment is entered. The Clerk is directed to enter a separate judgment hereon, in accordance with Rule 58, FRCP. CASE CLOSED. (Reader, L)

Post-judgment interest shall accrue at the legal per annum percentage rate in effect at the time of its entry, computed daily and compounded annually until paid, pursuant to 28:1961, beginning on the date this judgment is entered. The Clerk is directed to enter a separate judgment hereon, in accordance with Rule 58, FRCP. CASE CLOSED. (Reader, L)

titleInfo.title: HSBC Bank, USA v. Dara Petroleum, Inc. et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Senior Judge William B. Shubb on 4/22/2015: Stars Holding Co. LLC ("Stars"), Azad Amiri ("Amiri") and Sarbjit S. Kang ("Kang") are hereby ordered to personally appear on 6/29/2015 at 02:00 PM in Courtroom 5 (WBS) before Senior Judge William B. Shubb to show cause why they should not be adjudged in civil contempt for violation of this court's 5/2/2014 119. The hearing on plaintiff's application for issuance of an order to show cause, set for 5/4/2015, is vacated. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within 30 days from the date this Order is signed, HSBC shall serve a copy of this Order to Show Cause on non-parties Stars and Amiri in compliance with Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 4(e) and file proof of service with the court. (Kirksey Smith, K)

The hearing on plaintiff's application for issuance of an order to show cause, set for 5/4/2015, is vacated. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within 30 days from the date this Order is signed, HSBC shall serve a copy of this Order to Show Cause on non-parties Stars and Amiri in compliance with Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 4(e) and file proof of service with the court. (Kirksey Smith, K)

titleInfo.title: HSBC Bank, USA v. Dara Petroleum, Inc. et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Senior Judge William B. Shubb on 6/8/15 APPROVING 147 Ex Parte Application filed by HSBC Bank USA. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the hearing on the order to show cause shall be CONTINUED to 8/10/15 at 2:00 p.m. Show Cause Hearing RESET for 8/10/2015 at 02:00 PM in Courtroom 5 (WBS) before Senior Judge William B. Shubb. (Meuleman, A)
